com.rockwellgroup.arduinoconnect
Class ArduinoConnect

java.lang.Object
  com.rockwellgroup.arduinoconnect.ArduinoConnect

public class ArduinoConnect
extends Object

ArduinoConnect A class that connects to Arduinos by using unique Arduino serial ids.

Method Detail

connect

public boolean connect(String file_path,
                       String arduino_name,
                       char line_div,
                       int baud)
connect Attempts to connect to an arduino by looking up the arduino_name in a map that is saved in the file sated in file_path.

Parameters:
file_path - Holds the path to the file that holds the hashmap
device_name - Holds the name of the arduino on the map
line_div - Holds character that divides keys from values on the map
baud - Holds the baud rate of the arduino serial connection
Returns:
returns true if connection established

connect

public boolean connect(String device_name,
                       int baud)
connect Attempts to connect to the serial device at a specified port or by using a device id

Parameters:
device_name - Holds the name of the serial port or device id to which we will connect
baud - Holds the baud rate of the serial connection
Returns:
returns true if connection established

connect

public boolean connect(String device_name,
                       int baud,
                       char cb_flag)
connect Attempts to connect to the serial device at a specified port or by using a device id

Parameters:
device_name - Holds the name of the serial port or device id to which we will connect
baud - Holds the baud rate of the serial connection
cb_flag - Holds the char that triggers call of the serialEvent method
Returns:
returns true if connection established

connect

public boolean connect(int device_num,
                       int baud)
connect Attempts to connect to the arduino at the specified index location on the serial list

Parameters:
device_num - Holds the index number in the serial device array of the device to which we will connect
baud - Holds the baud rate of the serial connection
Returns:
returns true if connection established

connect

public boolean connect(int device_num,
                       int baud,
                       char cb_flag)
connect Attempts to connect to the arduino at the specified index location on the serial list

Parameters:
device_num - Holds the index number in the serial device array of the device to which we will connect
baud - Holds the baud rate of the serial connection
cb_flag - Holds the char that triggers call of the serialEvent method
Returns:
returns true if connection established

getConnection

public Serial getConnection()
getConnection Returns the serial object for direct access. The connection object is public and can also be accessed directly from the object instance as follows: instance_obj.connection.

Returns:
Returns the active serial connection

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
isConnected Returns true if the serial port is connect, false if the serial port is not connected.

Returns:
Returns the active serial connection

getSerialPortName

public static String getSerialPortName(String arduino_key,
                                       String file_path,
                                       char line_div)
                                throws FileNotFoundException,
                                       IOException
getSerialPortName Returns the serial port name by searching a hashmap the arduino_key. The maps it searches is stored in a file that is saved at file_path. All map key/value pair are stored on separate lines.

Parameters:
arduino_key - Holds the key/name of the arduino on the hash map
file_path - Holds the path to the file where the hash map is stored
line_div - Holds the character that divides the maps keys and map values
Returns:
Name of port to which the arduino identified on the hash map is connected
Throws:
FileNotFoundException
IOException

getSerialPortName

public static String getSerialPortName(String arduino_key,
                                       String file_path)
                                throws FileNotFoundException,
                                       IOException
getSerialPortName Returns the serial port name by searching a hashmap the arduino_key. The maps it searches is stored in a file that is saved at file_path.

Parameters:
arduino_key - Holds the key/name of the arduino on the hash map
file_path - Holds the path to the file where the hash map is stored
Returns:
Name of port to which the arduino identified on the hash map is connected
Throws:
FileNotFoundException
IOException

getSerialPortName

public static String getSerialPortName(String arduino_serial_id)
getSerialPortName Returns the serial port name where the arduino with the serial id specified by the arduino_serial_id parameter is connected. If the arduino is not it returns null.

Parameters:
arduino_serial_id - Holds the unique serial id of the arduino that we want to connect to
Returns:
Name of port to which the arduino identified on the hash map is connected

printArduinoSerialNumber

public static Hashtable<String,String> printArduinoSerialNumber()
printArduinoSerialNumber Prints to the console the unique serial id number for all Arduinos that are currently connected to the computer. This code will probably not work with a lot of Arduino clones, though it could easily be modified to do so.

Returns:
returns a Hashtable with the unique serial ids and port name of each arduino
